p: For viruses, one of the key steps in the emergence process is the jump between one host species and humans [ 37]. (For other kinds of pathogen, there may be other sources of human exposure, notably environmental sources or the normally commensal skin or gut flora). Various factors have been examined in terms of their relationship with a pathogen's ability to jump into a new host species; these include taxonomic relatedness of the hosts, geographical overlap and host range.
